precip_info: Rain amount describes how much rain is expected, typically given in millimeters (mm) or inches. It helps indicate the intensity of rainfall ‚Äî from light showers to heavy downpours.
precip_info_2: Rain probability shows the chance of precipitation occurring at a given time and location, expressed as a percentage. For example, a 70% chance means rain is likely in that area.
precip_info_3: Rain duration indicates the total number of hours during the day that rain is expected. This helps estimate how long the weather might stay wet or overcast.
precip_info_4: Rain intensity measures how heavy the rain is during a given period, typically classified as light, moderate, or heavy. Heavier rainfall can lead to flooding or reduced visibility.

model_disc_2: Global forecast by ECMWF, slightly lower resolution, highly reliable worldwide.
model_disc_3: High-resolution version of ECMWF‚Äôs global model. Known for top accuracy globally.
model_disc_4: Chinese national model from CMA. Good for Asia-Pacific, less accurate globally.
model_disc_5: Global model from Australia's Bureau of Meteorology. Best for Australia & Oceania.
model_disc_6: Regional model optimized for Norway and Scandinavia. Very accurate for the Nordic region.
model_disc_7: NOAA‚Äôs blended high-res + global forecast. Balanced accuracy with faster updates.
model_disc_8: NOAA‚Äôs global model. Fast, free, decent worldwide but less precise locally.
model_disc_9: Ultra high-res short-range US model. Best for hyperlocal US forecasts (0‚Äì18h).
model_disc_10: AI-powered forecast by Google DeepMind. Experimental, smooth & cutting-edge globally.
model_disc_11: Blended Japan Meteorological Agency model. Accurate in Japan & East Asia.
model_disc_12: High-res short-range forecast for Japan. Great for 0‚Äì36h predictions in Japan.
model_disc_13: Japan‚Äôs global forecast model. Lower res but reliable in Asia-Pacific.
model_disc_14: German Weather Service‚Äôs blended ICON model. Good balance for Europe
model_disc_15: Global version of ICON. Precise forecasts worldwide, especially Europe.
model_disc_16: High-res regional ICON for Europe. Best for central & western Europe.
model_disc_17: Ultra high-res short-term forecast for Germany. Ideal for next 24‚Äì48h in DE.
model_disc_18: Environment Canada‚Äôs blended forecast. Good across North America.
model_disc_19: Canada‚Äôs global model. Reliable for global forecasts, better in northern latitudes.
model_disc_20: Canadian regional model. High detail for local areas in Canada.
model_disc_21: Ultra high-res Canadian model. Best for pinpoint weather in Canada & nearby US.
model_disc_22: Blended national model. Accurate in France & nearby countries.
model_disc_23: Global model from France. Decent worldwide, especially for French territories.
model_disc_24: Europe-focused ARPEGE. More precise than global version.
model_disc_25: High-res national model. Best for local French forecasts.
model_disc_27: High-resolution ICON model tailored by ARPAE for Italy. Ideal for detailed regional forecasts.
model_disc_28: Integrated multi-scale forecast system combining global and regional models for smooth transitions.
model_disc_29: Global model with 10km resolution. Suitable for medium-range international forecasts.
model_disc_30: High-resolution 2km model focused on the UK. Excellent for local short-term forecasting.

best_match_full_best_for: Users unsure what model to pick
best_match_full_notes: Automatically selects the most appropriate model based on location and forecast range.
ECMWF_IFS_0.4¬∞_full_countries: Fully global (no regional specialization; consistent performance worldwide)
ECMWF_IFS_0.4¬∞_full_notes: Very reliable but lower spatial resolution than the 0.25¬∞ version. Great fallback model.
ECMWF_IFS_0.25¬∞_full_notes: Arguably the most accurate public global model. Used by many national agencies. Slower updates than GFS.
CMA_GRAPES_Global_full_notes: Lower global reliability. Performs best around East Asia.
BOM_ACCESS_Global_full_notes: Tailored for Southern Hemisphere. High-quality over AU/Oceania.
MET_Norway_Nordic_full_best_for: Local precision for Norway, Sweden, Finland
MET_Norway_Nordic_full_notes: Uses MET Norway‚Äôs in-house regional models. Very accurate in Nordic terrain.
GFS_Seamless_full_notes: Combines GFS high-res short-term with long-range. Good balance between speed and reliability.
GFS_Global_full_notes: Slightly less accurate than ECMWF, but faster and more frequently updated.
GFS_HRRR__full_notes: Super high-res (3km). Best for storms, hourly planning, airport ops.
GFS_GraphCast_full_notes: DeepMind‚Äôs AI forecast. Still experimental. Very good for visual consistency but not battle-tested yet.
JMA_Seamless_full_notes: National model with decent resolution. Blends short and long range.
JMA_MSM_full_notes: Very high resolution, excellent for metro areas like Tokyo or Osaka.
JMA_GSM_full_notes: Not as sharp as ECMWF or GFS, but stable in East Asia.
ICON_Seamless_full_notes: Transitions smoothly between resolutions. Good for large European areas.
ICON_Global_full_notes: Strong model globally. Among best for Germany and Central Europe.
ICON_EU_full_notes: High-res model. Great for terrain-rich regions.
ICON_D2_full_notes: Very detailed ‚Äî cities, valleys, small regions.
GEM_Seamless_full_notes: Blended with HRDPS and regional models. Good balance.
GEM_Global_full_notes: Moderate global accuracy, optimized for polar areas.
GEM_Regional_full_notes: High-res version for populated areas like Toronto, Quebec, Vancouver.
GEM_HRDPS_Continental_full_notes: Very high-res (2.5km). Focused on precision forecasting.
M√©t√©o_France_Seamless_full_best_for: General use in France and nearby countries
M√©t√©o_France_Seamless_full_notes: Blended for smoother transitions. High confidence over France.
M√©t√©o_France_ARPEGE_France_HD_full_not: Excellent detail ‚Äî rain, fog, wind, storm.
ItaliaMeteo_ARPAE_ICON_2I_full_notes: Based on ICON with ARPAE tuning. Strong for mountainous terrain.
UKMO_Seamless_full_notes: Smooth model transitions. Good for flights, sea, and national forecasts.
UKMO_Global_10km_full_notes: Strong global model. Good tropical performance.
UKMO_UK_2km_full_notes: One of the best models for dense urban UK settings.
KNMI_Seamless_with_ECMWF_full_notes: Combines KNMI short-range and ECMWF global models. Useful for aviation, marine, and national-level planning.
KNMI_Harmonie_Arome_Europe_full_best_for: Mesoscale weather features (e.g. thunderstorms, wind gusts)
KNMI_Harmonie_Arome_Europe_full_countrie: European countries including Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, France
KNMI_Harmonie_Arome_Europe_full_notes: Convection-permitting resolution. Very good for regional forecasting across European terrain.
KNMI_Harmonie_Arome_Netherlands_full_not: Ultra-fine resolution. Excellent for precipitation, wind, and local effects like sea breezes or fog.
